Thanks.

entry.title: Hide/Disable the Select option range in extension
entry.content:
TYPE-POOLS : scarr.
TABLES: scarr.

DATA: wa_res TYPE sscr_restrict,
wa_option_list TYPE sscr_opt_list,
wa_ass TYPE sscr_ass.

INITIALIZATION.
PERFORM initialization.

FORM initialization .
DATA: lv_program TYPE sy-repid,
wa_restriction TYPE sscr_restrict.

lv_program = sy-repid.
wa_option_list-name = 'S_TOEML'.
wa_option_list-options-eq = 'X'.
APPEND wa_option_list TO wa_res-opt_list_tab.

wa_option_list-name = 'S_CCEML'.
wa_option_list-options-eq = 'X'.
APPEND wa_option_list TO wa_res-opt_list_tab.

wa_ass-kind = 'S'.
wa_ass-name = 'S_TOEML'.
wa_ass-sg_main = 'I'.
wa_ass-op_main = 'S_TOEML'.
APPEND wa_ass TO wa_res-ass_tab.

wa_ass-kind = 'S'.
wa_ass-name = 'S_CCEML'.
wa_ass-sg_main = 'I'.
wa_ass-op_main = 'S_CCEML'.
APPEND wa_ass TO wa_res-ass_tab.
*wa_restriction

CALL FUNCTION 'SELECT_OPTIONS_RESTRICT'
EXPORTING
program = sy-repid
restriction = wa_res
* DB = ' '
EXCEPTIONS
too_late = 1
repeated = 2
selopt_without_options = 3
selopt_without_signs = 4
invalid_sign = 5
empty_option_list = 6
invalid_kind = 7
repeated_kind_a = 8
OTHERS = 9.
IF sy-subrc <> 0.
MESSAGE ID sy-msgid TYPE sy-msgty NUMBER sy-msgno
WITH sy-msgv1 sy-msgv2 sy-msgv3 sy-msgv4 DISPLAY LIKE 'E'.
ENDIF.
ENDFORM.

entry.title: Is it safe to switch from "Standard ABAP" to "ABAP for Cloud Development" if it compiles?
entry.content:
I'd like to prepare the custom code to be compatible with S/4HANA Public Cloud by switching the ABAP Language Version from  "Standard ABAP" to "ABAP for Cloud Development".

With the syntax check, I get partial information about which code needs to be rewritten (replacing BKPF with I_JOURNALENTRY, etc.)

For now, I don't want to run ATC checks for cloud-ready development, I'll do them later.

Without going to S/4HANA Public Cloud yet, if one program needs no modification, is it safe to not test it and keep the ABAP Language Version "ABAP for Cloud Development" in S/4HANA on premises?

Thanks.

Sandra

entry.title: VA01 payment terms input field value not getting retained in enhancement for transaction
entry.content:
When creating order in VA01, we are entering payment terms in the input and when the enhancement MV45AFZZ is analyzed in the debugger, the value of the payment terms from the user input for the field vbkd-zterm is not getting retained. instead the sap master data value is getting populated in vbkd-zterm and processed. How do I get the user entered zterm value in my enhancement scope?

 

Thanks in advance!!

entry.title: Extend nested standard CDS-Views
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I would like to dive deeper into the topic of view extensions of standard CDS views. I am familiar with the basic concept and the implementation, and everything is understandable for simple or flat CDS views.

However, there are hardly any standard CDS views that have only one level, but rather multiple ones. The question that arises for me is whether it is always necessary to extend all levels in order to access a field on the "top" level. Or what is the best practice in this case (for example: extend all views? Build a custom view on the interface view and join / associate the desired table/view again? etc.) 

For the sake of comprehension, here a concrete example:

The table VBAK was extended by a custom field, via append. I now want to include the respective field in the CDS view I_SalesOrder. The view I_SalesOrder has three hierarchy levels: I_SalesOrder -> I_SalesDocument -> I_SalesDocumentBasic. The latter selects the table VBAK.

Is it now the correct way to extend all three CDS views in order to be able to access the field in I_SalesOrder? 

Thanks in advance for the help.

Best regards,
Lukas

entry.title: Service Binding: Error during compilation.
entry.content:
Hi All,

On creation of  Service Binding  in Eclipse ADT - I Checked the underlying Views and Behavior Definition. It is not showing any Problem. 

Error during compilation - See next line for details. Error in entity 'ZS4T1_C_KUNDE(CDS)': Behavior definition for 'ZS4T1_C_KUNDE' has syntax errors.

Behavior Definition - As follows

managed implementation in class zbp_s4t1_r_kunden unique;

strict ( 2 );

 

define behavior for ZS4T1_R_KUNDEN alias customers

persistent table zs4t1_kunde

lock master

authorization master ( instance )

//etag master <field_name>

early numbering

{

create( authorization : global );

update;

delete;

 

field ( readonly ) Kunnr;

association _Orders { create; }

 

mapping for zs4t1_kunde

{

Kunnr = kunnr;

Name = name;

Vorname = vorname;

Firma = firma;

Str = str;

Stadt = stadt;

Land = land;

Pstl = pstl;

Sperre = sperre;

Adatum = adatum;

Fax = fax;

Telefon = telefon;

Email = email;

Url = url;

Sprache = sprache;

Bname = bname;

Passwort = passwort;

MemoTxt = memo_txt;

CurrencyCode = currency_code;

ZzumsatzZec = zzumsatz_zec;

ZzbcountZec = zzbcount_zec;

createdBy = created_by;

createdAt = created_at;

lastchangedBy = last_changed_by;

lastchangedAt = last_changed_at;

changedAt = changed_at;

}

}

 

define behavior for ZS4T1_R_PORDERS alias Orders

persistent table zs4t1_puroders

lock dependent by _kunde

authorization dependent by _kunde

//etag master <field_name>

{

update;

delete;

field ( readonly ) Kunnr, Orderid;

association _kunde;

mapping for zs4t1_puroders

{

Kunnr = kunnr;

Orderid = orderid;

Bdatum = bdatum;

Bsumme = bsumme;

CurrencyCode = currency_code;

Rabatt = rabatt;

Bstatus = bstatus;

Info = info;

createdBy = created_by;

createdAt = created_at;

LastChangedBy = last_changed_by;

LastChangedAt = last_changed_at;

changedAt = changed_at;

}

}

 

Regards

Shobhan

entry.title: Display List report as Result From RAP Application After Post Action
entry.content:
Hello Everyone.

I need Assistance on RAP result Display.

I am Posting Multiple Documents with One action 'Post' in One GO. Let say I have 10 entries in list and I am trying to generate document number for all of them.

In the same BDEF method after Document number generation , Result-%parm is getting updated for All entries with Document number and other Fileds respectively. 

I want to display this result-%parm as my output(As List) for the Action. but I am getting nothing as output and getting re-routing again to List Page. "not displaying  Result-%parm".

Please assist me here me here how to display result .

On Action 'POST' Cardinality is [1] Abstract entity.

*This Abstract entity has Document no. and all other fields.

This is A RAP service only. NO Fiori, UI or BTP involvement is here.

Please suggest how we can achieve list Output.

 

Thanks,

Abhishek Aggarwal

 

@sapcommunity @saptech @RaP

entry.title: TIMEOUT dump (11 min.) for RFC in low priority (runtime unlimited) if started in dialog
entry.content:
Hello,

I'm testing the timeout (or not timeout) in RFC tasks in Low priority (classic aRFC started by the method RUN_INST of CL_ABAP_PARALLEL, which I call from a custom program), and I'm surprised that a timeout happens after 11 minutes (short dump TIMEOUT) although the low priority has no timeout defined (so, unlimited runtime).

The TIMEOUT dump happens if the custom program is started in dialog, but it doesn't happen if it's started in background. In both cases, the priority is shown as Low in SM50.

The profile parameter rdisp/scheduler/prio_low/max_runtime has no value, so it should not do a timeout as the documentation says (it's also what the SAP notes say):

"If no value is specified, the runtime is unlimited."

11 minutes corresponds to the high priority set in the profile parameter rdisp/scheduler/prio_high/max_runtime.

The short dump TIMEOUT contains the message:

"The maximum runtime of a program is set by profile parameter "rdisp/scheduler/prio_low/max_runtime". The current setting is 660 seconds. If the current setting deviates from the value of the parameter in question, the application has set the maximum runtime itself. Once the maximum runtime is exceeded, the program is aborted."

For information, the profile parameter rdisp/max_wprun_time does not exist (it was deprecated by SAP a long time ago), so it means that the parameters rdisp/scheduler/prio_*/max_runtime are used.

The RFC starts this way (code started by running the method RUN_INST of CL_ABAP_PARALLEL) i.e., it's "aRFC with wait", so the application doesn't change the priority (anyway, I see Low in SM50, it must be the one used, even if it's changed):

      call function 'RS_ABAP_PARALLEL_INST'
        starting new task L_TASK-NAME
        destination L_SERVER_NAME
        calling END_TASK_INST on end of task
        exporting
          P_IN                  = <L_IN>
          P_TIME_OUT            = TIME_OUT
        exceptions
          COMMUNICATION_FAILURE = 1 message L_MESSAGE
          SYSTEM_FAILURE        = 1 message L_MESSAGE.

I can understand why RFC behaves like this. It makes sense.

Do you know any link to an official SAP documentation which clearly explains these behaviors?

Thanks.

Sandra

Environment: ABAP 7.58

entry.title: Making Fields Mandatory in "Managing Purchasing Info Record" App (Private Cloud Edition)
entry.content: As per Document # 3497433 - Making Fields Mandatory in "Managing Purchasing Info Record" App is not possible in S4 Hana Public cloud edition. However would like to check if that is an option available for Private Could Edition (FPS03) and the steps to achieve this. Basically the requirement is to make two fields (available from and available to) as mandatory in the Manage Purchasing Info Record (App ID: F1982) app. This should also be work/reflected for any backend or mass upload tool for PIR creation.

entry.title: Why Does BAPI_SALESORDER_CREATEFROMDAT2 Show Wrong Condition Values in VA02?
entry.content:
Recently, while working with BAPI_SALESORDER_CREATEFROMDAT2, I faced a strange issue.

 

I was trying to create a sales order with a custom condition type ZGTC.

Here’s what I did:

  • In the BAPI input, I passed KBETR = 94.0000000000.

  • During debugging, I could clearly see that the value was stored as 94.0000000000.

  • But after executing the BAPI and checking the order in VA02, the value appeared as 940.00!


    Why does the BAPI change my condition value from 94.00000000000 to 940.00?

entry.title: Call SAP BTP integration suite api from postman failing
entry.content:

I use the oauth/token url and I am getting successful access_token. I use client_id and client secret here. 

https://XXXXXX.authentication.xxxx.hana.ondemand.com/oauth/token

When I use the access_token and call below api - it sends back 200 with login page. 

https://xxxx.integrationsuite.cfapps.us10-002.hana.ondemand.com/api/v1/BuildAndDeployStatus(TaskId='LAKEHOUSE_CONNECT')

entry.title: How To CheckIn URL Attachment with API_CV_ATTACHMENT_SRV CreateUrlAsAttachment
entry.content:
Hi All, 

With this API I can successfully create URL Original in the Document Info Record, However that created URL Original is not checked In, How to do CheckIn with this API ? I dont see any parameter in this API to do CheckIn ? Is there any Other API which could do CheckIn as well ?

Enclosed the Successful Call with which the URL Original was created.

https://server:44300/sap/opu/odata/sap/API_CV_ATTACHMENT_SRV/CreateUrlAsAttachment?BusinessObjectTypeName='DRAW'&LinkedSAPObjectKey='ART000000000000005000000002701000'&Url='https://test.com'&UrlDescription='Link'&MIMEType='text/url'

As it can be seen in the Screenshot below, the Original was not locked, which means it is not checked In. 

Any Hint, how can i achieve this Lock along with the creation of the URL attachment.

 

 

BR,

Ketan
